meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sordid.
meanings.sent1: The sordidnesses of the abandoned building were evident in the dirty walls and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the sordidnesses of the crime scene, with its scattered evidence and bloodstains.
meanings.sent3: Despite its sordidnesses, the old motel had a certain charm that attracted adventurous travelers.
meanings.sent4: The sordidnesses of the corruption scandal tainted the reputation of the once-respected politician.
meanings.sent5: The sordidnesses of the poverty in the area were heartbreaking, with families struggling to make ends meet.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that are morally ignoble or base.
meanings.sent1: The sordidnesses of his betrayal left a deep emotional scar on her.
meanings.sent2: The sordidnesses of the scam were exposed when the truth came to light.
meanings.sent3: The sordidnesses of the gossip mill made the small town a difficult place to live.
meanings.sent4: She tried to distance herself from the sordidnesses of the criminal underworld.
meanings.sent5: The sordidnesses of the cover-up were revealed through careful investigation.
